page.title: 03Farming.(2) Barbridge.
page.content: July 4 l985.Milk 2400 litres. Sunny morning,rest of day dull. Up at 5.30a.m.to milk 120 cows.25 more dry and due to calve this month.Making second cut silage today.Tyres have to be taken off clamp and plastic sheets folded.Contractor came at 8.45a.m. & started work. Vet called on his monthly visit-8 cows to be pregnancy tested-all well.Silage making going well.Fetching cows up for afternoon milking found No.96 groggy. Suspect milk fever,so gave her a bottle of calcium,recovered after milking.Men continued silage making,I milked.A cup of tea and I took over ferrying grass to silage pit.Home for supper 9.30p.m. A good day's silage making, we got in 32 acres of good crop.
